translation.en: -[boy] Thank you. -[girl] Thank you.
[boy] I'm gonna test you on the plans in random order.
translation.ja: もう一度 確認しよう

translation.en: Never know which one we'll need and when.
It's vital we can communicate quickly and clearly in as few words as possible.
translation.ja: 明確かつ端的に 答えること

translation.en: [girl] Good start. Took you 30 words to explain what you're about to do.
[boy] Don't be facetious, Lucy. We really don't have time.
translation.ja: ふざけてる時間はない

translation.en: Now, what's Plan C?
[Lucy] Plan C means whoever isn't in combat makes a defensive circle.
translation.ja: 守備の人が防御円を作る

translation.en: Plan E mean you fight the visitor. I deal with the source.
translation.ja: Ｅはあなたが戦い 私は守備

translation.en: Plan D is the other way round. Plan B is salt-bombs.
translation.ja: Ｄはその逆　Ｂは塩爆弾

translation.en: Plan A is lavender water, and Plan F is Greek fire,
translation.ja: Ａはラベンダー水 そしてＦは——

translation.en: which should only be used indoors under carefully controlled circumstances.
translation.ja: 細心の注意を払う ギリシャ火薬

translation.en: -Ten out of ten. -There were only six.
Damn. I'll have to think of another four.
Thought there wasn't any time to be facetious.
Well, we're slightly ahead of schedule.
-Are you sure this is the right address? -62 Sheen Road. Mrs. Hope.
translation.ja: 本当にここ？ シーン通り 62番地 ホープ宅

translation.en: -[doorbell rings] -[boy] Quarter to six on the dot.
Here she comes. [sniffs]
[woman] Are you from the agency?
[boy] Mrs. Hope?
I'm Anthony Lockwood. This is my colleague, Lucy Carlyle.
translation.ja: ロックウッドと カーライルです

translation.en: We've come about your problem. Care to show us inside?
translation.ja: 依頼の件で中に入っても？

translation.en: Oh no, I won't set foot in there.
Not since my husband passed. Not since… how he passed.
translation.ja: 夫があんな死に方をして以来

translation.en: The disturbances have been very persistent.
I… I'm going to sell it, but it needs fixing first.
translation.ja: だから早く売り払いたい

translation.en: That is exactly what we do.
Locate the visitor, contain the source. A safe space means a satisfied customer.
translation.ja: “訪問者”を見つけ 霊源を始末します

translation.en: Shouldn't you have a supervisor?
I… I thought an adult had to be present at an investigation.
translation.ja: ２人だけ？　大人の監督は？ いないの？

translation.en: Strictly speaking, the law states
translation.ja: 法律で 訓練中の調査員には 監督者が必要です

translation.en: that an adult's only required if operatives are undergoing training.
translation.ja: 訓練中の調査員には 監督者が必要です

translation.en: But we don't find it necessary.
To be honest, adults are pretty useless.
'Cause of their lack of sensitivity. They just get in the way.
translation.ja: 感受性に欠けて 感じないのです

translation.en: One more thing, madam. Is there someone else inside the house? It's just, we saw--
translation.ja: 誰か中に？ 人影が見えたので…

translation.en: No. I've got the only key.
translation.ja: いいえ　鍵は１つだけ

translation.en: Here's the form you sent. Tells you all you need to know.
translation.ja: ここに全部書いたから 行くわ

translation.en: Now I have to go. It's almost curfew.
When I was your age, I was out chasing boys, having fun.
translation.ja: 私があなたの年頃には 男の子に夢中だった

translation.en: It's terrible the world's come to this.
I feel sorry for your generation.
Cheerful soul.
Real ray of sunshine.
[sighs] Ready?
Ready.
Heating's off.
Better be. It's freezin'.
Anything else?
[Lucy] Yeah, think so.
Shall we?
-[Lockwood] Hear something? -Yep.
Knocking. Very faint.
Can't tell from where. You?
Death-glow. So bright I should have brought my sunglasses.
translation.ja: 死光(しこう)だ サングラスがいる

translation.en: It's not funny. I heard him falling. Sounded brutal.
translation.ja: 笑いごとじゃない 誰かが落ちて来た

translation.en: It's not even six.
-Tea? -[Lucy] What does it say?
They moved here. Everything was fine. No manifestations.
translation.ja: 越してきた時 霊はいなかった

translation.en: Then, suddenly, he falls down the stairs and dies.
translation.ja: 突然夫が 階段から落ちて死んだ

translation.en: She thinks he tripped going to get a glass of water.
translation.ja: 水を飲みに行った時だ

translation.en: -Hmm. Very credible. -Sarcastic or ironic?
translation.ja: 役立つ情報 それ イヤミ？

translation.en: The cleverer one. [grunts]
-Do you think she pushed him? -Well, at least that'd be a motive.
translation.ja: 彼女が押した？ 動機がない

translation.en: Did she describe the apparition?
It says she felt like something was looking for her, but couldn't find her.
translation.ja: 動く影の存在を感じたらしい

translation.en: And the thought of it finding her was more than she could bear.
-So it has a purpose. -Which suggests a Type Two.
translation.ja: 理由がある… だとすると２種だ

translation.en: Sun's down.
How about we find ourselves a ghost?
[Lucy] Knocking's back.
Getting louder.
It stopped.
Soon as I stepped onto the landing. So it knows we're here.
-[bleeping] -[Lockwood] Temperature's dropping.
[Lucy] Right, torch off. I need to tune in.
Pick a door. Any door.
-Go with the furthest. -Why?
[Lucy] It's the scariest.
-Office. -Yeah.
But not always. Look.
Pressure marks. Deep, wide apart.
Perhaps this used to be the bedroom before the Hopes moved in.
translation.ja: ホープが住む前は 寝室だった

translation.en: I can feel it. This is where the source is. Can't… can't you feel it?
translation.ja: 霊源はここ 感じるわ

translation.en: Don't let it get to you. Keep active. Go get the bags. Make a circle.
translation.ja: 触られるなよ 防御円を作るんだ

translation.en: -I'll check the other rooms. -Filings or chains?
translation.ja: 他を見て来る 鉄粉か鎖(くさり)？

translation.en: Oh, filings.
Sure? It's still early, it's already this strong.
-It's not that strong, plus… -Plus what?
I forgot to bring the chains.
You forgot to bring the chains?
George took them out to oil them. I didn't check he'd put them back, so…
translation.ja: ジョージが油をさして そのまま…

translation.en: it's George's fault.
Anyway, it doesn't matter. We don't need them for a job like this. Filings will be just fine.
translation.ja: これくらいの仕事は 鉄粉で大丈夫

translation.en: [sighs] Bloody amateurs.
[Lucy] Lockwood?
-[whispering continues] -[Lucy] Lockwood?
[strained voice] Lockwood…
[Lockwood] Just a sec. There's another death-glow.
Something nasty happened here too a long while back,
which means there might have been two violent deaths in this house.
[Lucy, louder] Lockwood! It's urgent!
translation.ja: ロックウッド　すぐ来て！

translation.en: Thing is, I don't see how the first death's got anything to do with the Hopes,
translation.ja: １人目の死は ホープと関係ない

translation.en: so perhaps the disturbances weren't caused by Mr. Hope…
translation.ja: 夫人を悩ませたのは 夫ではないな

translation.en: -[female voice murmuring] -No. Well done.
-They weren't. -Ah.
-You got anything from her? -Haven't tried.
translation.ja: 何か分かった？ まだよ

translation.en: Been busy trying to make contact with the living.
translation.ja: あなたを呼んでたから

translation.en: Why not have a go before she gets any closer?
She's in pain.
-Of course she is. She's dead. -No, something's different.
translation.ja: 死人だから 違うの

translation.en: -[Lockwood] What's different? -Ssh!
I can almost…
[whispering] Let go of me!
Let go of me!
Let go of me.
[screeching] Let go of me! Let go of me! [screams]
[man] Tell me about your daughter, Mrs. Carlyle.
[Mrs. Carlyle] Well, she's always had talent, ever since she was a baby.
translation.ja: 幼少期から才能がありました

translation.en: She used to keep us up all night with her crying.
translation.ja: 泣いている理由が 泣いている理由が 〝殉職した若者たち〞 〝殉職した若者たち〞

translation.en: We thought there was something wrong with her,
translation.ja: 〝殉職した若者たち〞 不明でした

translation.en: until we realized she was hearing them in the street outside her window.
translation.ja: 〝殉職した若者たち〞 娘は霊の声を聞いたのです 娘は霊の声を聞いたのです 娘は霊の声を聞いたのです 〝ジェイコブ 除霊探偵局〞

translation.en: -[man] So she's a listener? -[Mrs. Carlyle] Gifted.
translation.ja: 〝ジェイコブ 除霊探偵局〞 “霊聴感”(れいちょうかん)？ 〝ジェイコブ 除霊探偵局〞

translation.en: When she was six, she saw a visitor on the marshes.
Heard it long before she saw it, or she wouldn't be here with us now.
translation.ja: それ以前から 聞こえていたんです

translation.en: She does sound special. And you're in luck. We've a vacancy.
translation.ja: ちょうど欠員があり 採用できます

translation.en: I lost one of my operatives the day before yesterday, poor lad, but…
translation.ja: 昨日 調査員が１人 殉職したので

translation.en: he was about her size, so maybe she could have his old uniform.
translation.ja: 彼の作業着をそのまま使える

translation.en: Well, that'd be wonderful.
Mrs. Clarke will take care of the paperwork.
We're ever so grateful.
Aren't you gonna give me a smile, young lady?
[Mrs. Clarke] You confirm that the child is of legal age to be an operative?
translation.ja: 法的に認められた年齢？

translation.en: [Mrs. Carlyle] Yes, 13 last week.
And has adequate ability to sense the presence of Type One and Type Two visitors,
and to defend against them?
Yes.
You understand she'll be exposed to significant risk
translation.ja: 職務には 死亡などのリスクが伴います

translation.en: of trauma, injury, and death whilst carrying out her duties?
translation.ja: 死亡などのリスクが伴います

translation.en: Yes.
And that beyond completion of training and issuance of protective equipment,
translation.ja: 保護服を自分で購入して

translation.en: it's her responsibility to safeguard herself at all times?
[Mrs. Carlyle] Yes.
[Mrs. Clarke] Payment will be made on the last Friday of each month.
translation.ja: 給与の振り込み口座は？

translation.en: -Into whose account? -[Mrs. Carlyle] Mine.
translation.ja: 給与の振り込み口座は？ 私宛で

translation.en: I don't want to do it. It scares me. I don't want to be scared all the time!
translation.ja: やりたくない　すごく怖いの

translation.en: Everyone's scared all the time. What makes you so special?
I'll get a job somewhere else. Anywhere else.
translation.ja: ここ以外なら何でもする

translation.en: I just want to stay in school. I want to be normal.
Listen to me, young lady.
Your father left us with nothing when he drank himself to death,
translation.ja: お前の父親は 酒浸りになり死んだ

translation.en: so you'll go in there Monday morning,
and smile and charm and work hard and be grateful,
translation.ja: 感謝して 笑顔で働きな

translation.en: or so help me God, I will show you what being scared really feels like.
translation.ja: そうしないと 怖い目に合わせるよ

translation.en: Ladies and gents, this is Lucy Carlyle. She's a listener.
translation.ja: ルーシー･カーライル “霊聴感”がある

translation.en: Mother says she's gifted, but we'll be the judge of that.
Norrie, look after her, show her the ropes.
translation.ja: ノリー 教えてやれ

translation.en: Careful. Don't get any on you. It's deadly poisonous.
translation.ja: 猛毒だから気をつけて

translation.en: [Jacobs] Poisonous and extremely expensive.
Any you spill comes out of your wages.
translation.ja: こぼせば給料から差し引く

translation.en: [Lucy] That's the explosive?
Sand, salt and silver fulminate.
translation.ja: 砂と塩そして雷酸銀(らいさんぎん)

translation.en: Reacts with their plasm.
[Jacobs] Remember, iron forms a barrier between you and a ghost.
translation.ja: 鉄の鎖は幽霊をバリアする

translation.en: The stronger the ghost, the stronger your barrier must be.
translation.ja: 強い霊には 相応のバリアが必要

translation.en: Type Ones are weaker. Type Twos are more powerful.
Never show them your fear.
Know why he carries that silver flask all the time?
translation.ja: いつも銀のビンを 持ってる

translation.en: [Lucy] No.
[Norrie] 'Cause it's the only way he'll ever trap any spirits.
translation.ja: 酒を飲むしか能がないから

translation.en: -You know why he's so pale? -No.
translation.ja: やつの顔色が悪いのは

translation.en: He gets the shit scared out of him three times a night.
You know why he's called Jacobs?
No.
-'Cause he's fricking crackers. -[laughs]
[Jacobs] Swan Hotel. Top floor corridor.
translation.ja: スワンホテル 最上階の廊下

translation.en: No one will take any of the rooms because of strange and unpleasant sensations.
translation.ja: 幽霊のせいで ホテル客がいなくなった 幽霊のせいで ホテル客がいなくなった 〝スワンホテル〞

translation.en: Find the spirit and neutralize it.
translation.ja: 〝スワンホテル〞 霊源を見つけて始末しろ 霊源を見つけて始末しろ

translation.en: [Norrie] What is it, Luce?
-[yowling] -[Norrie] Can you hear somethin'?
It's here. [gasping]
-It's coming. Behind us! -What?
-What are you doing? -[Norrie] Listen to her, Paul.
She knows what she's doin'.
-What's your name again? -Lucy Carlyle.
Nice work tonight, Lucy Carlyle.
Your rapier is your most vital piece of kit.
translation.ja: 剣(レイピア)は最も重要な武器になる

translation.en: Its iron blade wards away the specters.
translation.ja: 鉄の剣が幽霊を追い払う

translation.en: Disperses them.
The more proficient you become, the longer you'll live.
translation.ja: 腕を磨けば命も伸びる

translation.en: -Lucy! Help! -[voices screeching]
[Jacobs] In recognition of two years at Jacobs & Co.
and achieving third grade,
her own rapier and copy of the Fittes Manual.
translation.ja: レイピアとフィッテス教本だ

translation.en: A true asset to the agency…
translation.ja: 功績をたたえる　おめでとう

translation.en: Lucy Carlyle.
[Norrie] Why couldn't I have been born a Fittes?
translation.ja: フィッテスの娘だったらな

translation.en: Why wasn't I called somethin' fancy, like Penelope or Marissa?
translation.ja: ペネロペやマリッサのように

translation.en: Whoever heard of anyone rich and famous called Norrie?
translation.ja: ノリーなんてダサい名前

translation.en: She's got a cupboard full. She'll never notice.
Oh God. Maybe this is how it starts.
How what starts?
How you end up like Jacobs,
or any of the other sad sack adults in this shitty town.
translation.ja: ジェイコブのような大人に

translation.en: -Drinking whisky at four in the afternoon? -Ahh! It's just a sip. To celebrate.
translation.ja: ４時に酒なんて 一口だけ お祝い

translation.en: No! We can't work for Jacobs till our talent fades.
translation.ja: ここで大人になって 才能を失うのはイヤ

translation.en: We can't let our parents piss our money up the wall.
translation.ja: 給料はすべて親に使われる

translation.en: Let's go to London. Tonight.
translation.ja: ロンドンに行こう 今夜

translation.en: Get interviews at Fittes and Rotwell. Make something out of ourselves
translation.ja: フィッテス財団で働くの

translation.en: before our names end up on that giant gravestone in the square.
translation.ja: 殉職して名前が刻まれる前に

translation.en: I can't.
I haven't passed fourth grade yet.
They'd send me back or put me on night watch.
So we fake the letters or bullshit our way in.
translation.ja: 書類を偽造すればいい

translation.en: It's the talent that counts, not bits of paper.
Yeah, then wait, until I'm fully qualified.
translation.ja: もう少しで資格が取れる

translation.en: It's not long. Just next year,
and… then I don't need anyone's permission.
translation.ja: 誰の許可もいらなくなる

translation.en: And we'll meet with all the big agencies. There'll be a bidding war to sign us up.
translation.ja: そして一流の探偵局と 契約をするの

translation.en: And in a couple of years, we'll be the most famous agents in the country.
translation.ja: 数年後には 有名な調査員になって

translation.en: We'll be on the cover of every magazine.
The ghost of Marissa Fittes will come back from the dead
translation.ja: あの世からよみがえった

translation.en: and drag her raggedy arse out of her coffin
translation.ja: フィッテスの霊に会う

translation.en: -and beg us to sign up with her. -She'll beg! [laughs]
translation.ja: そして契約よ 彼女とね

translation.en: Your solemn and binding promise.
My solemn and binding promise.
translation.ja: 私たちの聖なる約束よ

translation.en: [Jacobs] Right, Moorgate Mill.
Logging company wants to clear it and sell it on to a developer.
translation.ja: 木材会社を売るために 除霊を希望

translation.en: Records of visitations are vague, but everything points to a Type One.
[Norrie] Mr. Jacobs?
Is it true you met Marissa Fittes?
translation.ja: フィッテスに会ったことは？

translation.en: I trained at Fittes in London while she was alive.
She came to watch us during sword practice.
translation.ja: 剣の練習中に彼女が来た

translation.en: What was she like?
Magnificent. Before she and Rotwell
discovered the link between visitors and sources, it was chaos.
translation.ja: 始めて 霊から 霊源を突き止めた人だ

translation.en: Riots in the streets, scores killed every day.
translation.ja: 大勢が幽霊に殺された

translation.en: She changed everything.
The only person ever to hold an actual conversation with a Type Three.
translation.ja: ３種に遭遇したのは 彼女だけ

translation.en: So when you say you met her, you mean you were briefly in the same room as her?
translation.ja: 彼女と同じ部屋にいたの？

translation.en: It's closer than you'll ever be.
Closer to history.
Right. 'Cause it all started from nowhere,
translation.ja: フィッテスとロットウェルが

translation.en: then Fittes and Rotwell magically appeared.
All a bit convenient, isn't it?
-Here we go, Mr. Conspiracies. -What do you believe, then?
translation.ja: あなたは何を信じるの？

translation.en: We don't know the real story about the Problem.
So clever and handsome.
translation.ja: 賢くてハンサムなのに

translation.en: -Such a radical thinker, isn't he, Lucy? -Hmm!
Find the visitor, locate the source, contain it and get out.
translation.ja: 訪問者を見つけ 霊源を確保するんだ

translation.en: I don't wanna be here all night.
-[Paul] Anyone gettin' anything? -[Norrie] Nothin' yet.
translation.ja: 何かある？ まだ何も

translation.en: But it's absolutely freezin', and I do not like what that's tellin' us.
translation.ja: 凍りつくような寒さ 何だか様子が変

translation.en: It sounds like a child.
Down there.
Something's wrong.
-I don't think that's a Type One. -[high-pitched laughter]
We'll follow it. You report to Jacobs.
No. We should all leave, get more equipment,
make a plan, then come back.
If we leave, we'll lose it. Go, Lucy, please.
translation.ja: 戻ったら見失う ルーシー 行け

translation.en: Everyone else, come with me. Stay close.
translation.ja: 他の皆は一緒に来るんだ

translation.en: Be careful, Norrie.
[breathing heavily] We found something.
I thought it was a phantasm or shadow child at first.
Now I'm not so sure. I think…
-I think you should get everyone out. -Because you're not so sure?
translation.ja: 撤退させて 分からないのに？

translation.en: -I need more. What's your evidence? -It's nothing clear. Just… just a feeling.
translation.ja: 根拠は？ 悪い予感がする

translation.en: We don't make decisions based on feelings.
Maybe you could come in too? See what you think?
Just do your job.
[whispers] Oh God.
-[Paul] What is that? -[girl] Too close!
[Paul] It's coming through! Aah!
Someone!
-Quickly! -[explosions]
[Lucy] Norrie!
-Norrie, move! -[screeching]
[Paul] I need some chains now!
Lucy, Norrie, close the door! Save yourselves!
translation.ja: ルーシー ドアを閉めて 逃げろ

translation.en: Norrie!
-Norrie, no, no! -[explosions]
Norrie! Norrie!
Sir! Sir, please!
She's ghost locked!
translation.ja: 呪縛(じゅばく)にかかった

translation.en: Sir, please, we need your help! Sir, sir!
-No, sir! Sir! -[explosions continue]
[Lucy] They're dying!
Norrie!
Sir, no!
[crying] No, no! Sir!
[Jacobs] I acted entirely in accordance with the information Miss Carlyle brought to me.
translation.ja: ルーシーの情報の元 作戦を実行しました

translation.en: It's a pity she wasn't more forthright.
Many young lives might have been spared.
[woman] And you heard no cries for help,
nor any indication of a disturbance,
until Miss Carlyle emerged from the building
and there was no more that could be done?
-[Jacobs] None whatsoever. -That's not true.
You were standing in the doorway. I saw you.
translation.ja: 入り口にいたあなたに 助けを求めた

translation.en: -I was screaming right at you! -[coroner] Quiet, please!
translation.ja: 入り口にいたあなたに 助けを求めた 静粛に 言葉を慎むように

translation.en: You'll speak only when you're spoken to.
translation.ja: 静粛に 言葉を慎むように

translation.en: In the cases of the fatal ghost touch
translation.ja: 霊触(ゴーストタッチ)を受けたのは以下の４名

translation.en: of Alfie Morgan, Joy Young, Paul Bell, and Abraham Kosta,
translation.ja: Ａ･モーガン　Ｊ･ヤング Ｐ･ベル　Ａ･コスタ

translation.en: I hereby rule death by misadventure.
Their parents will receive due relief
translation.ja: 遺族はフィッテス財団より

translation.en: from the Fittes Fund for Bereaved Families.
Well done.
In the case of persistent morbid ghost lock suffered by Norrie White,
I will recommend her for subsidy
by the Department for Psychical Research and Control's Veteran Support Fund.
translation.ja: 心霊研究所の 支援基金によるものです

translation.en: [woman] Will she ever wake up?
Will she ever come back?
[man] The best we can do is keep her comfortable.
[Mrs. Carlyle] Look at me. Look at me, young lady.
translation.ja: ちゃんと私を見なさい

translation.en: I'm not having you moping round here all day and night.
And I'm not spending the rest of my days getting dirty looks
because I am the mother of the girl who caused those kids to die.
translation.ja: 世間の冷たい視線をあびる

translation.en: First thing tomorrow, I am taking you to Jacobs, and you'll apologize.
translation.ja: 明日に局長に謝るんだ

translation.en: You'll admit you're to blame and ask him to take you back.
translation.ja: 非を認め謝罪するのよ

translation.en: If he doesn't, you will beg until he does. Do you understand?
[whispers] Yes.
I understand that you don't care about me.
Or Norrie.
Or the truth.
She was my best friend.
We were a family. You think I'd ever do anything to hurt any of them?
translation.ja: 家族同然の友を 傷つけるわけない

translation.en: -That's enough. -No, it's not.
All my life, you treated me like I was nothing,
translation.ja: いつも私を無視してきた

translation.en: till I could make you a bit of money.
All I wanted
is for you to love me.
But you're incapable.
You can't feel anything. You are deader than dead.
translation.ja: 母さんは死人同然だもの

translation.en: He's expecting us at nine.
[woman] Excuse me.
Excuse me. Is this your first time in London?
It can be dangerous here, especially at night.
If you need somewhere safe, come to one of our centers.
translation.ja: 私たちの団体へどうぞ

translation.en: No, thanks. I'm… I'm fine, thanks.
[woman on PA] …forms to the desks on the lower level and report for interview and processing.
translation.ja: 書類は１階に 提出してください

translation.en: [man] ID, references, and parental permission, please.
translation.ja: 身分証明と親の承諾を

translation.en: I'm sorry, I don't have any of those,
but I do have my grades one to three certificates, with special commendation.
translation.ja: ３級までの 資格があります

translation.en: No paperwork, no processing.
-Please. I've been waiting over an hour. -I'm sorry. There's nothing I can do.
translation.ja: １時間も待った お引き取りを

translation.en: [sighs] If I could just talk to someone, tell them about my talent,
I promise I won't be wasting your time.
It's your own time you're wasting. Next time, bring your parents.
translation.ja: 書類を持って出直すのね

translation.en: Please. I've come hundreds of miles, and I have nowhere to sleep tonight.
translation.ja: 遠くから来て 泊まる当てもないんです

translation.en: Just give me ten minutes to explain.
You think you're the first person to knock on this door with that story? Move along.
translation.ja: 聞きあきたセリフ 他を当たりなさい

translation.en: ♪ If you say you will ♪ -♪ If you could say you will ♪ -[bell rings]
translation.ja: “Ａ･Ｊロックウッド 除霊探偵局”

translation.en: [boy] Are you Arif's new girl?
Who's Arif?
Runs the corner shop, usually sends round donuts about now.
translation.ja: 角のドーナツ店のおやじ

translation.en: But you don't have any donuts, so you'll be another candidate.
I thought we'd finished. Name?
translation.ja: まだいたんだ　名前は？

translation.en: Lucy Carlyle. Are you Mr. Lockwood?
translation.ja: ルーシー ロックウッドさん？

translation.en: Me? No.
-Uh-- Well, can I see him, then? -Don't see why not.
translation.ja: お邪魔しても？ いいけど

translation.en: The last one's just gone in, but from the looks of her, she won't be long.
translation.ja: 先の人はすぐ帰るから

translation.en: [Lockwood] Okay, take a look at this. Tell me what you think it is.
translation.ja: これを見て感じるのは？

translation.en: [girl] Oh my God! Get that away from me!
See? Told you so. Okey-dokey, if you'd like to follow me?
translation.ja: ほらね　言ったろ？ 君の番だ

translation.en: You win. There was one more.
No, you win. I checked the list. That was the last one.
translation.ja: リストには名前がない

translation.en: Then who's this?
Hello. I'm Anthony Lockwood.
translation.ja: アンソニー･ロックウッドだ

translation.en: I'm Lucy Carlyle. I don't have an appointment,
but I saw your advert in the paper, and I was in the area.
You've heard of us?
No.
My CV.
Would you like some tea? Or has George already offered?
I thought I'd wait until after the first test, see if she's still here.
translation.ja: テストが終わってから 出そうと

translation.en: We've wasted enough tea bags today.
Let's give her the benefit of the doubt and pop the kettle on.
translation.ja: 決めつけるのは まだ早い

translation.en: All right, but I reckon she's a bolter.
[Lockwood] Sorry about him.
He gets very tetchy when he's hungry. Take a seat.
translation.ja: 腹が減ってイラついてるんだ

translation.en: So you've got the sight and the touch, but primarily, you're a listener.
translation.ja: 霊感があり 強みは“霊聴力”か

translation.en: Hmm. I've got good touch, but it sometimes merges with what I hear.
translation.ja: 聞くことが得意で 感覚がさえます

translation.en: Touch sometimes triggers the sounds.
George can do a bit of that. Not me. Sight's my thing.
translation.ja: ジョージも同じ才能だ 僕は“霊視力”

translation.en: Death-glows, trails, all the ghoulish residues of death.
translation.ja: 死光や死の痕跡を 見分けられる

translation.en: It says here you trained up north with a local operative named Jacobs.
translation.ja: ジェイコブという 霊媒所で仕事

translation.en: -Got your grades one to four, I presume? -Hmm. That's right.
-Did he give you a reference? -[Lucy] No.
My last employment ended… uh… abruptly.
translation.ja: 契約が突然打ち切られました

translation.en: I could tell you the whole story if you want,
translation.ja: 隠すつもりはないけど

translation.en: but it's just not something I like dwelling on.
Some other time, then.
Ah! Finally.
-Shall we get on with the tests? -What tests?
translation.ja: 先にテストを どんなテストですか？

translation.en: The advert didn't say anything about tests.
Well, frankly, I don't set much store by references or referrals.
translation.ja: 正直 履歴書は重要じゃない

translation.en: I prefer to see talent with my own eyes.
translation.ja: 能力は自分で確かめる

translation.en: Please, take a biscuit. George will only eat them all.
translation.ja: ビスケットをどうぞ食べて

translation.en: What do you think… this is?
translation.ja: さて これは何だと思う？

translation.en: Uh… It's silver-glass, made by the Sunrise Corporation.
translation.ja: サンライズ協会の銀ガラス

translation.en: Ahem. It's… it's a ghost-jar.
The skull's the source, and the ghost is tied to it.
translation.ja: 頭蓋骨(ドクロ)が霊源 霊が付いてる

translation.en: Couldn't tell you what sort. Phantom or a specter, maybe?
translation.ja: 幻霊か死霊のどちらかね

translation.en: That's right. Well done.
She was shaken. You could see it.
You know I can hear you when you say things like that?
Where did you get it? Only Fittes and Rotwell had them.
Time for questions later. Now, tell me, what do you think of this?
translation.ja: 質問はあとだ これから何を感じる？

translation.en: -I can hear… gunshots. -[dog barking]
-Gunshots? -Sounds nasty.
No. They're not violent or sad. There's no suffering.
translation.ja: 暴力や悲しみはないわ

translation.en: This belonged to someone…
happy, gentle.
Very good. My uncle. Used to take it with him on hunting trips.
translation.ja: 狩りをする 僕の伯父のものだ

translation.en: Even had it with him when he keeled over from a stroke.
translation.ja: 急死した時に持ってた

translation.en: He was a nice bloke. Shame.
How about… this?
There's death attached to this. A lot of death. It's vile.
translation.ja: この時計には 多くの悲惨な死が付いている

translation.en: I don't know what this is or where you got it, but nobody should hold it.
translation.ja: 誰も触れるべきじゃないわ

translation.en: Certainly not in the context of a job interview.
translation.ja: 面接で使う物じゃない

translation.en: It's a memento of my first successful case.
translation.ja: 最初の案件の戦利品だ

translation.en: -Heard of the mass murderer Harold Beck? -No.
translation.ja: 連続殺人鬼のベックは？

translation.en: And I don't think I want to, thanks very much.
That's very sensible. Horrible business.
translation.ja: 賢明だ　その方がいい

translation.en: Now, finally, give this a go.
I… I can't sense anything.
Really? Are you sure?
Try a little harder, why don't you?
No, I'm positive. Nothing.
I should hope not.
-That's George's toothbrush cup. -[George giggles]
I didn't come here to be made fun of.
I don't know what kind of so-called agency this is,
but as far as I can see, it's about as prestigious
as a couple of pathetic schoolboys playing agents before their parents get home.
translation.ja: 坊やたちの遊びに 付き合えない

translation.en: I'll see myself out.
[whistles] Feisty.
Step over here, and I will show you how feisty I am.
translation.ja: 立ちなさい 強さを見せてあげる

translation.en: -Maybe I will. -I don't see you moving.
This is a deep armchair. Takes a while to get up.
translation.ja: ソファが深くて立てない

translation.en: I'll wait.
Miss Carlyle, I apologize for upsetting you,
translation.ja: 不快にさせて悪かった

translation.en: but I assure you this is a genuine enterprise,
translation.ja: でもまともな探偵局だ

translation.en: and that was a serious test.
Which you passed with flying colors.
You'd be amazed how many candidates make up some cock-and-bull story.
translation.ja: 大勢が面接で でたらめな話をする

translation.en: It'd be the most haunted cup in London if the mildest of their tales were true.
translation.ja: あのカップに悪霊がいるとね

translation.en: -Tell her about the biscuit rule. -What?
translation.ja: ビスケットルールがある

translation.en: [George] She can't go taking two at once like that.
Each member of the agency can only take one biscuit at a time in strict rotation.
translation.ja: メンバーが食べていいのは １度に１枚

translation.en: Keeps things fair.
Ea… Each member of the agency?
Assuming you are still interested in the position?
Yes.
I'm interested.
Excellent. How about I give you a tour of the house?
translation.ja: 採用だ　案内しよう

translation.en: I can understand why you might think our setup's a little unusual.
translation.ja: 少し変わった探偵局だろ？

translation.en: We're a new agency, been registered three months.
We're accredited with DEPRAC,
translation.ja: 除(Ｄ)霊(Ｅ)探(Ｐ)偵(Ｒ)管(Ａ)理(Ｃ)局の認定

translation.en: but we're not on their payroll like Fittes or Rotwell.
translation.ja: だがフィッテスの 管理下にない

translation.en: We're independent, and we like it that way.
translation.ja: 独立した探偵局だ 〝天才青年が優勝〞 〝天才青年が優勝〞

translation.en: [Lucy] Who are your supervisors?
translation.ja: 〝天才青年が優勝〞 上司は誰？

translation.en: [Lockwood] No supervisors here.
translation.ja: 〝天才青年が優勝〞 いないよ

translation.en: No adults. It's my company, hence the name. That bother you?
translation.ja: 僕が局長だ　大人はいない

translation.en: Uh… Sounds all right.
Bathroom, my room, George's room.
translation.ja: バス 僕 ジョージの部屋

translation.en: Wouldn't go in without knocking. Walked in on him doing yoga once, totally naked.
translation.ja: 必ずノックを 彼は裸でいるから

translation.en: -Got quite an unusual view. -[laughs weakly]
Huh? What about that room?
[Lockwood] That's private.
Nothing very interesting. Follow me, lots more to see.
translation.ja: 何でもない普通の部屋だ

translation.en: The library is through there, but this is the most important room.
translation.ja: 図書室はそこで 一番重要なキッチンがここだ

translation.en: We call this the thinking cloth.
We jot down memos, theories, trains of thought.
translation.ja: ここに考えを書き留める

translation.en: It's a very useful tool.
I located the bones of the Fenchurch Street Ghoul
by sketching out the street plans here at three in the morning over cheese on toast.
translation.ja: フェンチャーチ通りの 骨の場所を見つけた

translation.en: [George] When a case goes badly and we're not talking to each other,
translation.ja: ケンカ中の筆談にも 役立つんだ ケンカ中の筆談にも 役立つんだ 〝ロックウッドの〞

translation.en: it's good for exchanging insults too.
translation.ja: ケンカ中の筆談にも 役立つんだ

translation.en: -Ah. How often does that happen? -Almost never.
-Now… -[opens door]
translation.ja: 〝ばかやろう〞 さて次は さて次は

translation.en: The basement. Follow me.
Offices. Case files.
George is obsessed with the history of the Problem.
He's a fastidious record keeper.
It's a good thing, too. I get brain-ache writing a shopping list.
Training room.
Randomized smoke jets simulating a variety of attack and defense patterns.
translation.ja: 攻撃と防御の シミュレーション

translation.en: George came up with it. Every now and then, it actually works.
You'll be proficient with a sword already as you've passed your fourth grade.
translation.ja: 君は４級なら 剣は使えるね

translation.en: Of course.
Now, finally, our high-security storeroom.
translation.ja: 厳重管理された保管室

translation.en: It's unlocked.
Note to self.
Heighten security on high-security storeroom.
[Lucy] Wow.
You never know what's coming.
[Lucy] You still haven't told me where you got that haunted skull.
[Lockwood] It's George's. He likes to experiment on it.
See how it responds to different stimuli.
You still haven't told me.
He stole it.
Come on. I'll show you the attic.
This is where I slept when I was little. You can use it, if you like.
translation.ja: 昔ここで寝てた 使っていいよ

translation.en: -Unless you've other arrangements? -Yes.
-No. I mean-- -We'd deduct the rent from your wages.
translation.ja: ないけど… 家賃は給料から引く

translation.en: Nothing too steep, just enough to cover the bills. I'm a very reliable landlord.
translation.ja: 高くはないよ 大家が僕だからね

translation.en: It's, uh… got its own bathroom. There's a bigger one downstairs,
translation.ja: バスルーム付き 下のバスはジョージも使う

translation.en: but that'd mean sharing with George, and I wouldn't wish that on anyone.
translation.ja: 下のバスはジョージも使う 共有は嫌だろ？

translation.en: Right, well, I'll leave you to unpack. Settle in.
-That's assuming-- -Those newspaper clippings on the wall…
[chuckles] Oh! You saw those. Not very modest, is it? Should really take them down.
No, it's more… It's just… Well, it's just, you haven't said anything about…
translation.ja: あなたのことを 何も知らないから

translation.en: I mean, who are you?
Plenty of time for that. You should rest. Get some sleep.
translation.ja: それはまた追々 今日はゆっくり休んで

translation.en: That's… if you'll take the job?
Yes.
Well, then, welcome to Lockwood & Co.
translation.ja: ロックウッドへようこそ

translation.en: ♪ Squash every week into a day ♪
-I know what you're thinking. -[gasps]
But it's forbidden.
-Oh. The door? -Yeah, the door.
-I was gonna get a glass of water. -You'll have more luck in the kitchen.
translation.ja: 水を飲もうと キッチンへ行けよ

translation.en: -Why does he keep it shut? -I've no idea.
-How long have you lived here? -About a year.
-Oh, so you know him pretty well? -Well enough.
'Cause… I'm just wondering about the house. How he came to live here.
translation.ja: この家のことを知りたいだけ

translation.en: -I'm guessing it belonged to his-- -To his parents?
translation.ja: なぜ彼の… 両親のこと？

translation.en: Ask him yourself. He's usually in the library at this time of night.
translation.ja: 図書室にいるから聞けば？

translation.en: He'll be less desperate for the lavatory than I am now.
translation.ja: その話はしたがらない

translation.en: So if you'd excuse me.
Hello.
Oh. Hello.
Sorry, am I interrupting? Only, I'm not tired, so…
No. No, not at all. Come in, sit down.
translation.ja: ああ いいよ 座って

translation.en: What are you readin'?
Just keeping up with what's going on in town.
Parties, that kind of nonsense.
You'd think there'd be less of them since the Problem,
but for the rich, it's quite the opposite.
Nothing they like more than to lock themselves in a posh hotel
and thrill with horror at the thought of all the visitors lurking outside.
translation.ja: “訪問者”のことで 盛り上がる

translation.en: DEPRAC held one last week.
translation.ja: 先週 パーティーに

translation.en: Everyone who's anyone was there.
Were you there? Can I see your picture?
No. So… no.
When your advert said that this is a prestigious agency,
translation.ja: 有名な探偵局だと 広告にあったけど

translation.en: it's not strictly true, is it?
You've only been working three months. I read the papers and I've never heard of you.
translation.ja: 新聞で名前を見たことがない

translation.en: Mild exaggeration.
Lots of people make them.
Like you, when you told me you'd passed your fourth grade.
I called DEPRAC.
I'm sorry. Look, I… I am good enough. I promise.
translation.ja: ごめんなさい でもきっと役に立つ

translation.en: It's just… the way things ended with my last agency was--
Whatever happened then is in the past. What counts is the future.
translation.ja: 過去は関係ない 大事なのは未来だ

translation.en: I know you're good enough to be here. I saw it with my own eyes.
translation.ja: 君の才能は この目で確かめた

translation.en: And trust me, we might be a new outfit and a little unorthodox,
translation.ja: 経験も浅く 知名度もないが

translation.en: but one day, this will be one of the most successful agencies in London.
translation.ja: ロンドンで大成功してみせる

translation.en: And I want you to be part of it.
Thank you.
Th… there is just one other thing.
Name it.
You've said I'm good enough for you. You've seen what I can do, but…
translation.ja: 私はあなたにとって 必要な存在

translation.en: how do I know you're good enough for me?
[visitor] Let go of me!
[Lockwood] Lucy!
[Lucy] Lockwood!
-Please! -Hold on, Lucy!
I'm gonna fall!
[Lucy] I'm slipping!
[yelps] Lockwood!
Lucy!
-Did it touch you? -Course not. I'd be dead.
translation.ja: 触られた？ いいえ でも危なかった

translation.en: Lucy, if you don't feel steady, we should just go home now.
translation.ja: 一旦 撤退しようか

translation.en: No, I'm fine. It's just…
Just what?
When I connected with her, it was different.
translation.ja: 彼女から何かを感じるの

translation.en: -What do you mean? -I saw how she used to be.
translation.ja: 何を？ 昔の姿を見た

translation.en: More than that. It was like I-- I could feel what she was feeling.
translation.ja: それに 感情も伝わった

translation.en: She's a ghost. Ghosts don't have feelings.
No, trust me. This was like nothing I have ever felt before.
translation.ja: 信じて こんな経験初めて

translation.en: You need to calm down.
-You need to listen to me. -The parameters have changed.
This is not just an old couple's argument anymore.
It's the ghost of a murder victim, and she's gonna be back any second,
translation.ja: 殺された女の霊だ また来るぞ

translation.en: so if your head's not in the right place…
Show me where she went.
She faded before she reached the wall, but that's where she was headed.
[Lucy] Chimney breast. Probably where the body is.
translation.ja: 遺骸(いがい)はこの壁の中ね

translation.en: -This wall's been replastered. -Oh, careful. You broke the circle.
translation.ja: 壁は後付けだ 防御円を踏んでる

translation.en: She's back. [gasps]
Boring. You've done that already. Try something new, why don't you?
translation.ja: もっとマシなことを してみろ！

translation.en: Don't taunt her, Lockwood. She's angry.
translation.ja: 霊を挑発して 怒らせないで

translation.en: -[Lockwood] Nearly there. -Hurry up.
[Lockwood] Here it comes.
My sword!
Lockwood!
Lockwood!
[Lockwood] This is not good.
-That's her. -[Lockwood] The body's the source.
translation.ja: いたわ 遺骸が霊源 銀の網で封印しろ

translation.en: I'll hold her back. You get a silver net over it.
translation.ja: 遺骸が霊源 銀の網で封印しろ

translation.en: In other words, Plan F.
That's not Plan F.
Uh, I… I mean, Plan B.
Plan B's salt-bombs. She's too strong for that.
For God's sake. I'll draw her off. You contain the source.
translation.ja: 誘い出すから 霊源を頼む

translation.en: That's Plan E!
When this is over, we need to totally rework the lettering system.
translation.ja: 作戦名はどうでもいいや

translation.en: Speak for yourself.
Let go of me!
-[Lockwood] Lucy, behind you! -[visitor screams]
Lucy, hurry!
Lucy!
Are you okay?
Apart from our client's house burning to the ground, absolutely fine.
translation.ja: 顧客の家を燃やしちまった

translation.en: What took you so long? What were you doing back there?
I told you. Something wasn't right. Something was different.
translation.ja: 何か様子がおかしいの

translation.en: -I had to-- -Had to what?
What wasn't right? We secured the source, didn't we?
Yes, but… This is not the right time to be having this conversation.
translation.ja: ええ でも今は それどころじゃない

translation.en: Agreed. We should jump while there's something left to jump from.
translation.ja: ここから飛び下りよう

translation.en: Jump? You must be mad. We're way too high. We'll break our necks.
translation.ja: 冗談でしょ？ 首の骨を折るわ

translation.en: Ready? One, two, three!
